meanings.definition: In a way that is unique to an individual
meanings.sent1: She idiosyncratically arranged her bookshelf by color, unlike anyone else.
meanings.sent2: He always dresses idiosyncratically, mixing patterns and colors in a unique way.
meanings.sent3: The cat idiosyncratically decided to nap in the flowerpot instead of its cozy bed.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork stood out idiosyncratically, like a splash of color in a black-and-white world.
meanings.sent5: The old house was idiosyncratically decorated with vintage movie posters and antique clocks.

meanings.definition: In a distinctive or peculiar manner
meanings.sent1: The comedian told jokes idiosyncratically, often using props in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent2: The clock chimed idiosyncratically, with a melody unlike any other timepiece.
meanings.sent3: The dog idiosyncratically chased its tail in circles, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: His car idiosyncratically sputtered to life, like an old engine reluctant to start.
meanings.sent5: The tree in the yard grew idiosyncratically, twisting and turning in unusual shapes.
